data.title: Slow to warm up but a real pleasant experience all around with unique drinks !
data.text: We arrived as the sun was setting and wanted a light dinner and drinks. We elected to sit inside at the bar through there is a great front patio dining street walk side and a patio in the rear which is more secluded. The menu appeared to be unique and the drink selection and beer selection looked great ! We sat at the end of the bar and received almost no recognition for quite some time. It appeared that there was one Bar manager/tender and four trainees. Sunday night on a football TV night is not the time to train mixologists ! Our trainee was as memory challenged as Dory in Finding Nemo !  We were served by I guess the bar manager on duty Stefan ? At least that's the name on the receipt....Things did improve...One of their signature drinks is a Hickory smoked Old Fashioned. Gotta see this...They char a square of wood with a torch then sit the glass on it to absorb the char on the rim and the sie essence in the glass then pour in an "Old Fashioned" highball cocktail. EXTREMELY UNIQUE. The food was excellent...All the soups are made in house. The Poki or Tuna TarTar was excellent and very reasonable compared to may other restaraunts in the area. We will return !  C&H

data.title: Dog friendly, yummy food for you and your pet!!
data.text:
Food and service both excellent!! Incredibly dog friendly restaurant; have the cutest dog food menu with chicken, burgers and rice for your canine friends!!! 

Salads, burgers, wings and wine all amazing!! Gets very busy on weekends!! Service is overall very good!!

data.title: great patio and food
data.text: nice patio dining on a very warm mid day with misters to keep you cool, fun place, good food nice staff, would go there again

data.title: Excellent food, nice vibe
data.text: Go here w friends! Very casual! Mostly local people! I ordered a pear salad w salmon and my coworkers ordered chicken burger w fries and salad! We all were satisfied! My salmon was yummy and the portion was great too

data.title: Fabulous Brunch!
data.text: We hosted a Sunday brunch for 12 at 1909 and were very happy. They take reservations and asked if we wanted to be seated on the porch or inside.  The porch was great and they turned on some heavy duty heaters to take the chill off.  The bloody mary cart was a big hit with the guests, but the star of the show are the amazing breakfast entrees.  Try the berry soaked French toast, or any of the egg dishes, they are all great.  Two guys loved the Relleno dish in particular.  Funny, cool server too!  We'll be back.

data.title: A great meeting destination
data.text:
Not only is 1909 a great meeting destination but they've got a wonderful menu and Killer Bloody Mary's. 
Drop in and graze their menu.
You'll be glad you did.

data.title: Fabulous food and great fun!
data.text:
The food is great. I had Lamb and my husband had a burger. Both were outstanding. 
A nice variety to choose from. Save room for a creative dessert. OH YA if your there for Brunch or Breakfast you have to try their Bloody Mary. A meal in it self

data.title: Great!
data.text: Chilaquiles are fantastic- really everything on the menu is!  They have bacon-salted fries...need I say more?  Full bar and the BEST bottomless mimosas in town (they do NOT skimp on the refills!). Service has been awesome every time we've gone.  Fun, funky industrial decor. Limited indoor seating and plenty of outdoor seating - right in the heart of old town.  Highly recommend!

data.title: Old style California?
data.text:
For a California visitor, the combination of misters and heaters in the outdoor area is strange. Certainly practical though.
Good beer selections from both California and out of state breweries.
We had fish tacos and a bison burger. No one left hungry. The sweet and smoky fries are an interesting taste.

data.title: Barbara Hitchins
data.text:
We spent an evening there recently. The food was outstAnding. Cheese platter. a 10..
Chicken and vegetable dinner excellent   
The lamb is fabulous too the three pots of different chocolate mouse dessert is out of this world. Wow it was good

data.title: Date Night!
data.text: If you are looking for somewhere to catch a bite to eat in Old Town this may be the spot.  We sat outside so we could people watch.  Price is affordable and service was great.

data.title: Dinner with the Fam
data.text: We recently stumbled upon this restaurant when we were walking through Old Town Temecula. The patio was packed at night compared to all of the other restaurants in town, so we decided to try it and were not disappointed! We had the Chicken Sammie, 1909 burger and kid's Mac n cheese. All came with a side and were cooked perfectly. We also had two of their cocktails that were the best we have ever had. My husband had the Cedar Smoked Old Fashioned and I had the "Dirty Diana." Both were aaaammmmmaaazing!

data.title: Great service, great food, beautiful town!
data.text:
We dropped into the 1909 on a warm Sunday afternoon for lunch, it was brimming full yet they had our large party of 8 seated within 5 or so minutes and served quickly!

The food was great, no one had a meal they were disappointed in and most wanted to "sample" everyone else's food, that's a good sign!

Staff were attentive and nice, something you expect but don't alway receive!  We can't visit often as we live in Australia, but if we're ever back, we'll come back!

data.title: Favorite Work Lunch Spot
data.text: This is a favorite spot for my department at work, situated just down the hill from our beautiful city hall.  I always enjoy the 1909 burger each time I go, just a habit I've developed.  They have a relaxed atmosphere and posted on the chalkboards around the room are interesting drink recipes.  The purse hook underneath the table is perfectly ingenious!  If you dine outside they have misters keeping you cool in the lunch hour heat.  You have to absolutely try their signature burger :)

data.title: Great place
data.text:
We came with a wedding rehersal party of 30ish people and were sat outside on the veranda, a great spot for people watching.
Service was good, although the drink order was slightly confused.
Decor and ambiance was cool but not too cool, plus the music choice was excellent.
We were on a set menu and it was an varied choice of entrees. I went for the burger which was amazing, especially the fried bacon and onion topping!! Other people sat near me went for a chicken salad which was great apparently.
Good selection of beer and service with a smile, will return and recommend.

data.title: A busy place in Old Town
data.text:
Yikes, we came in to eat on Thursday nite and the place was cranking!
Ordered the fish tacos which, in our opinion,  would have been better with the fish grilled instead of deep fried....Waitress did not offer an option so we had the deep fried. Another family member dining earlier was smart and asked for grilled fish on the taco!!
Waitress pleasant. Bar service a little slow, however. When will restaurant staff learn that if you serve up beverages quickly the customers would be happier?  A universal observation in many cases with slow bar service.

data.title: Great Resturant
data.text:
This is a great place to eat, the menu is well balanced and they even have a dog menu!
 I would recommend this place wholeheartedly.

data.title: One of our favs in Temecula
data.text: This restaurant is great! Love the variety of choices, have tried almost everything on the menu and it's all excellent.  Local micro brews, local wines, great patio seating, friendly and attentive staff.  Eat a great meal and people watch.  It truly is one of our favs in the city.

data.title: Great Sunday brunch!
data.text:
Jessica was a wonderful server! Sunday brunch was really good. Good atmosphere and nice ambience. Very reasonably priced as well. 

Peach sangria French toast was amazing. The middle with mascarpone.....need I go on? The highlight of the meal was my husbands breakfast potatoes however. I'm  afraid (not really ;)) that I ate a lot off his plate. So we ordered another side of them. Best potatoes ever. 

Hubby had the pull pork Benedict and he said it was very good but you can't go wrong with pork anything really. He had a favorite place for breakfast potatoes and 1909 blew that place out of the park. Is it obvious we really liked them? Lol

I love how it's situated in old town cuz you can walk around and try to work off some of the amazing food you just had. 

Will definitely be returning for brunch in the future and also will try them out for dinner

data.title: Great Sunday breakfast!
data.text: They have bottomless mimosas on Sundays, and they don't skimp on the champagne (like they do at other establishments on bottomless mimosas)!!  If your meal doesn't come with bacon, make sure you order a side of it - nice, thick, great maple flavor!  Service was fast, and friendly!
